titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4299) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 1995 for intelligence, and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, the Community Management Account, and the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-566, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4299 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence now printed in the bill. No amendment to the committee amendment shall be in order unless printed in the Congressional Record before its consideration.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 180.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/28/1994--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 4299 (intelligence activities authorization).
